page.title: 03ECOLOGY. SOUTH BROOK.WILDEN.
page.content: South Brook flows from West to East of Block through Wilden village -an area offering a natural habitat. In order for the brook to "live," it is important it doesn't become overgrown.The planting of trees in the close proximity of the water is avoided. Observations show that the stretches of the brook which have most wild flowers are those open to the sunlight. The same principles apply to conserving the small natural ponds which exist in the area. Those which were visited sadly showed signs of neglect, although attempts are being made at the Old Rectory pond to improve the light and encourage new growth and wildlife. The pond opposite the Victoria Arms offers enormous potential to the visual amenity of this part of the village.
